channel.title: [code help]
channel.description: Could anyone give me a code to make my server show the wilderness sign and then the wilderness level under it..Please and thank you. xD

item.title: [code help]
item.dc:creator: @fungame4u fungame4u
item.description:
@fungame4u wrote:

public boolean inwildy = false; public boolean inwildy2 = false; public void checkwildy() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3672)) { inwildy = false; } else { inwildy = true; } } public void checkwildy2() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3514)) { inwildy2 = false; } else { inwildy2 = true; } }

Is mine…

Read full topic

item.title: [code help]
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

You might not have the wild designated.

public void checkwildy() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3672)) { inwildy = true; } else { inwildy = true; } }

search for something like that and make sure you’ve designated the coords where the wildly begins.

Edit: That does work, generally one someone hasn’t made a mistake, or corrupted another part of the code.

Read full topic

item.title: [code help]
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Essentially search for that and make sure you have it. If you do not…

outStream.createFrame(208); outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197); sendQuest("Level: "+WildyLevel, 199); leftwild = 1; }

Then add it under this area. after the last {

checkwildy2(); int oldlevel = WildyLevel; WildyLevel = (((absY - 3520) / 8) + 1); if(inwildy2 && WildyLevel != oldlevel) {
